website_summaries.verdict: While its included mounting stand is a plus, this saw can take time for newer woodworkers to get the hang of, meaning broken blades.
pros: Scroll saw and included table are easy to assemble, users note
Has good power, and cuts smoothly and quietly
cons: Less experienced users may go through quite a few blades getting the hang of the saw
Plastic blade surround tends to wear out after a few uses

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have put in about 20 hours of cutting with no problem. One needs to get the feel of the tension for cutting blades. I went through 5 on a basic cut. Once I got the feel of the tension adjustments I have had smooth sailing!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Okay for beginners.....
customer_reviews.text: For a beginner, it is a decent saw. As others have mentioned, the plastic piece becomes eaten up by the saw blade vibrating and it is not level with the work surface. After using the saw for three months (very light use), the dust blower stopped working. I opened the cover and found that the bellows is a cheap rubber type thing that now has a big crack in it. I just sent an email to Porter Cable and will update here what I find out for them. If they want me to take it to a service center, forget it. The part is enough to change myself and the saw is too bulky to be moving around like that.
customer_reviews.author: C. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Sad it’s not a better saw!
customer_reviews.text: This scroll saw could be great, if they would fix the “wobble” in the blade! You really cannot do any intricate work with this saw because the only way to correct the wobbly blade is to go fast. If the the manufacturer would fix that issue it would be a great saw. Two stars for the fact that it is sturdy, blades are fairly easy to replace, and comes with it’s own base. Returned it because of the wobble!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value for a hobby scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price; initially intended to get the Delta scroll saw but the price jumped $130 while in my cart. The best feature of this scroll saw is that you can make all adjustments at the end of the neck where you affix the blade. Make sure both ends of pinless blades are seated in the back of the holders, if not, the blade can come off mid-cut.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Huggins

customer_reviews.title: No complaints... Exacting enough to carve out individual letters.
customer_reviews.text: This scroll saw works quite well. Initially, I broke a number of blades getting the hang of it so if you're new to scrolling, buy plenty of extra blades.
customer_reviews.author: Corey C.

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome saw; high quality, heavy-duty, and with more features than the Dewalt - which is more than twice the price. It really is an unbelievable value for such a high-quality machine. Trust and believe.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.T.

customer_reviews.title: Good scroll saw
customer_reviews.text: My young son has started to show an interest in doing some woodworking with me so I wanted to start him on a scroll saw. This saw was a great price and had good reviews so we gave it a shot. We are very happy with the ease of use and how well it cuts. My son absolutely loves this saw and is even more excited about woodworking projects.
customer_reviews.author: William Sr

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Use the machine for cutting very thin Kydex. (Plastic, 1/16 to 1/8 thickness.) Only used it a few times and the "Locking Arm" which holds the blade broke in half. Made of cast (I don't know what.) Cheap construction. Owned it only four months. New part costs $37.00 and Labor. Very disappointed. Save your money Chuck
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: If you want a scroll saw for beginners or pros. This is the one
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this. Easy to change blades. Bright light. Love this scroll saw.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Added equipment to wood working process.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the reviews that were available before I bought. There was one in particular that explained based on that persons experience the need to do some simple things to make this product go from a 3 to a 5. I followed the review instructions and indeed I now have a 5. I do 3d type of items.
customer_reviews.author: Bill88

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new scroll saw. Trued a Craftsman ( got my money back ) then I bought this one. True to the description it is easy to change blades, light works great, dust blower is by far the best one I have found. I would tell you that if you want one then buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: dman4698

customer_reviews.title: Scrolling
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new scroll saw. He can do so much more with this scroll saw then he was with his smaller one. He is quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: dotsie totsie

customer_reviews.title: quality saw and stand.
customer_reviews.text: Great scroll saw. Adding some wood to make a shelf strengthened the legs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing saw
customer_reviews.text: I love it got it for my wife for her crafts and it’s an amazing saw so happy I went with the extra money for the stand it’s a life saver took me a little while to lean how to change the blade but as far as that it’s amazing and my wife loves it
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great scroll saw! Much better than I had hoped for. Shipped out fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: if I could have one change on the product I would like it to have a little higher speed
customer_reviews.text: Performs well for the price, if I could have one change on the product I would like it to have a little higher speed.
customer_reviews.author: Mike F.

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Saw works great. Not happy about plastic wing nut on blade clamp. I will be replacing that with metal. Otherwise, could not be happier for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Simon

customer_reviews.title: Bad blade run-out
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable well-made machine BUT misalignment caused blade run-out (side to side movement) beyond what could be fixed with blade-holder screw adjustment. Maybe I expect too much from a low-priced tool, but why put up with something that's going to make quality work that much harder? I was allowed to return it but what a hassle disassembling and re-boxing everything. I should have bought from a local dealer to make replacement easier.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smaller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have only used a couple times but I,m please with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it to cut 12mm pvc for a contract job, it is challenging to keep a good cut going, but I'm new to using a scroll saw. It's made the work actually fun, and so much more clean a cut than my previous attempts with other methods. The unit developed a slight squeak early on, which a few drops of machine oil took care of. (Back of upper arm assembly) the blade change is extremely simple. The dust blower does not bend quite enough to actually clear the cut point, not sure if I'm missing something.
customer_reviews.author: Project Mangler

customer_reviews.title: upset with stand
customer_reviews.text: The scroll saw is ok for my needs, but I had to buy better blades. The instructions to put the stand together is impossible to make sense of to me, and I have put similar stands together with no problem. The stand has not been put together and don't know if it ever will be, I put it on a table and screwed it on, but that is just a temporary fix. I wish someone could show me some diagrams how to put this together. ok slowly with many pictures I figured out the stand, but now 1 month later, it doesn't want to cut straight. nothing under $500 is 100% good.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisChicago

customer_reviews.title: Easy blade mounting
customer_reviews.text: Rugged and well built. Easy blade mounting. Good lighting and dust blower. Speed control very good. But too much vibration!! No provision for mounting castors for small shop relocation. Owners manual needs magnifying glass to trace assembly instructions and parts list.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ray Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw. A BEAR to assemble to the stand
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. A BEAR to assemble to the stand. The mounting holes do not line up as they should. Had to do some drilling to get it to fit to the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Draper

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars

customer_reviews.author: kurt jockisch

customer_reviews.title: Sad face.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the whole experience, it was exactly what I needed..

customer_reviews.text: even though legs for the stand were marked 2 rear and 2 front, there actually were three rear legs and only one front leg so it is not balanced and very hard and unable to use this way. I would appreciate another FRONT marked leg.
customer_reviews.author: jim

product_meta.title: 18" Variable Speed Scroll Saw with Stand
product_meta.description: The PCB375SS features a broad 12-5/8" x 20" aluminum dual tilting table, enabling 45 degrees left and 15 degrees right bevel cuts for a range of accurate cut angles visible on a scale conveniently and securely situated in the tabletop. An upfront tool-less blade holder and a cam action blade tension adjustment allow woodworkers to quickly and easily change and regulate pin or plain blades. It also includes an upfront on/off switch that simplifies speed control changes between 500-1,500 SPM, a die cast aluminum frame, and a large cast iron base that reduces vibration in cutting heights ranging from 2-1/4" (45 degrees right) and 1-1/4" (45 degrees left) to 2-1/4" (maximum cutting height). The saw includes blade storage and a study steel stand.
feature_bullets: Large aluminum 20" x 12 5/8" dual tilting table allows for bevel cutting up to 45 degrees
Patented table top bevel scale for accurate and convenient readings
Tool-less blade holder makes quick and easy 5" pin or plain end blade changes
Built-in adjustable LED work lamp for better illumination of work area
Variable speeds between 500 and 1500 SFM with upfront control knob
